properties.areaDesc: Ashe; Western Greenbrier; Watauga; Mercer; Bland; Grayson; Tazewell; Alleghany; Smyth; Summers
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 29 at 10:45PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
Melting of snow Saturday may have resulted in patchy areas of
black ice on untreated roads. This will be especially true
for the western mountains of North Carolina, parts of southwest
Virginia, and southeast West Virginia where 1 to 3 inches of snow
fell Friday night, with isolated snow totals in excess of 5
inches across southeast West Virginia.

Temperatures warmed just enough above freezing Saturday to permit
some of the snow to melt. This melt water then develops into
patches of black ice at night when temperatures drop below
freezing.

Temperatures are expected to warm above freezing by 1100 AM
Sunday morning.

Use extra caution if you plan to travel through areas which
received snow. Reduce speed, avoid sudden breaking, and allow
extra distance between you and the vehicle in front of you.

NWSheadline: Black Ice Possible through Sunday Morning
